abstract: Ehud Olmert, former Israeli prime minister twice declared guilty of corruption, is convicted of of fraud and breach of trust in retrial of 2012 case; originally beat charges of accepting $600,000 from American businessman, Morris Talansky; retrial became warranted after Olmert's longtime aide became a state witness.
lead_paragraph: The charges related to a case involving an American businessman, whose testimony in a Jerusalem court in 2008 was instrumental in the former leader’s downfall.

headline.main: Ehud Olmert, Israeli Ex-Premier, Is Convicted of Fraud
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Israel: Ex-Premier Convicted of Fraud

snippet: The charges related to a case involving an American businessman, whose testimony in a Jerusalem court in 2008 was instrumental in the former leader’s downfall.
